author: mklement0
body:
Closely related: #13489

In a `-`-prefixed argument (that ends up _not_ being a named argument), an embedded variable reference isn't expanded unless it happens to be preceded by `:`

## Steps to reproduce

```powershell
Write-Output -foo=$HOME | Should -Be "-foo=$HOME"
```

## Expected behavior

The test should succeed.

## Actual behavior

The test fails, because the variable reference is unexpectedly not expanded.

```none
Expected strings to be the same, but they were different.[...]
Expected: '-foo=/Users/jdoe' But was:  '-foo=$HOME'
```

## Environment data

```none
PowerShell Core 7.2.0-preview.2
```
title: Parameter parsing/passing: a hyphen at the start of an argument situationally prevents string interpolation
